medical_history.chief_complaint: 48 hours of vomiting and abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 48 hours prior to admission, with vomiting occurring 12 times (non-bloody, non-bilious) and sharp abdominal pain that initially started in the epigastric region and progressed to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and left lower quadrant (LLQ). There were no fevers, diarrhea, or constipation noted. Anorexia was present. Patient was seen in the emergency room 2 days ago for the same symptoms and was sent home.
